conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows walls with height and thickness, a perceivable interior, an angled view, and the roof removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have appropriate height and thickness (5/5). Floors are clearly distinct from walls (3/3). Interior volume is very perceivable (4/4). Proper 3D wall corner geometry is present (3/3). Angled view is good (5/5), and interior is visible from an elevated perspective (3/3). Minimal perspective distortion (2/2). Roof is cleanly removed (5/5), and interior spaces are fully visible (3/3). The geometry is clean with no broken sections (2/2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: The number of rooms is correct, and adjacency relationships are mostly preserved, though 'Activity' area is merged with 'Alfresco' in 3D (10/12). Major wall positions align well (5/5). Wall lengths are proportional (3/3). Internal partitions are correctly placed (2/2). Doors are present and on correct walls (4/4). Windows are present and on correct walls but some small windows missing (1/2). Openings are proportionally sized (2/2).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present, including beds, sofas, and tables (4/4). Kitchen elements are present (2/2). Bathroom fixtures are present (2/2). Furniture is placed in correct rooms (3/3). Furniture scales are reasonable (2/2). Orientation is logical (0/2 - some furniture orientation mismatch, e.g., 'Master Suite' bed, 'Living' TV stand).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, and openings are clearly distinguishable (4/4). Geometry is readable (4/4). Interior is clearly visible (3/3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3/3). Consistent material usage (2/2). No major rendering artifacts (2/2). Clean background (2/2).

detected_errors.description: The 'Activity' area seems to be merged with the 'Alfresco' area in the 3D model, losing its distinct enclosure as shown in the 2D plan. No wall separates it.
Some smaller windows from the 2D plan, especially in bathrooms and WCs, are either missing or significantly altered in the 3D render.

The orientation of some furniture, particularly the bed in the 'Master Suite' and the TV stand in the 'Living' room, does not match their orientation in the 2D floor plan. The small table & chair in the 'Study' are missing from the 3D render.

summary: This 3D render is an excellent transformation of the 2D floor plan, demonstrating strong fundamental 3D conversion and high geometric accuracy, with only minor discrepancies in room separation and furniture placement.
